thread.title: UNWTO strongly condemns attack in Bangkok
thread.title_full: UNWTO strongly condemns attack in Bangkok

author: eTN Global Editor
title: UNWTO strongly condemns attack in Bangkok
text:
UNWTO strongly condemns attack in Bangkok   
Aug 18, 2015 UNWTO Secretary-General Taleb Rifai eTN   
MADRID, Spain - UNWTO is deeply saddened and shocked by the attack in Bangkok, Thailand. On the behalf of the global tourism community, UNWTO offers its heartfelt condolences to the families and friends of the victims and reiterates its full support to the people and the Government of Thailand. 
“These are direct attacks on the livelihood of the Thai people and their economy which is strongly linked with tourism. We stand by the Government and the people of Thailand in supporting its tourism sector as a vital pillar of the wellbeing of Thai people”, said Mr Rifai. 
“Terrorism is a global threat impacting our societies, taking the lives of innocent people around the world and aiming to destroy our economies and our way of life. Thailand has a long tradition of being a hospitable and welcoming country and we fully believe it will continue to be so”, he added.
